page.title: 02Summary of the area (p.2)
page.content:
The village green with its duck pond is the main attraction of the village. The green covers about 3 acres and is one of the largest in the country. The adult football team uses it on Sunday mornings and the cricket team on Saturday afternoons. The village school children use it to play games.
The main annual event on the Green is WREA GREEN FIELD DAY. On the last Saturday in June a Fancy Dress parade is held and during it the "Queen" is crowned after which sports and a children's tea take place.
There is a small industrial estate providing work on the site of the disused railway station.
